metadata.Title: CVE-2019-12526 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Squid before 4.9. URN response handling in Squid suffers from a heap-based buffer overflow. When receiving data from a remote server in response to an URN request, Squid fails to ensure that the response can fit within the buffer. This leads to attacker controlled data overflowing in the heap.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-12526` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

squid - 4.9-2ubuntu1
squid-cgi - 4.9-2ubuntu1
squid-common - 4.9-2ubuntu1
squid-purge - 4.9-2ubuntu1
squid3 - 4.9-2ubuntu1
squidclient - 4.9-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: squid package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.9-2ubuntu1').
